Package org.berthold.beamCalc

Class ShearingForceTable

java.lang.Object
org.berthold.beamCalc.ShearingForceTable
public class ShearingForceTable
extends java.lang.Object
A table consisting of ShearingForceValue- objects which are representing the loads acting and their position. This is acts as an helper-Â class for the QSolver- class and holds the final result of the calculation whih can be optained by invoking the getter method for the qTable.
Author:
Berthold

  • Constructor Details

    • ShearingForceTable

      public ShearingForceTable​(Beam beam, double sectionLength_m)
      A new QTable. Creates a new table for the passed Beam-object and adds the supporting forces.
      Parameters:
      beam - A - object from which the table is build.
      sectionLength_m - Sections between the forces acting.

  • Method Details

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Number of values inside the table of shearing forces.
      Returns:
      Size of the table.

    • getSectionLength_m

      public double getSectionLength_m()
      Section length.
      Returns:
      The length between each section the beam is divided into (the space between the shearing forces).

    • getShearingForceAtIndex

      public ShearingForceValue getShearingForceAtIndex​(int index)
      Shearing force at a specified index in the table. This method is used by the QSolver- and MSolver the class. When adding a shearing force use the addForce() method which calculates the index in the table depending from the section length and the position of the force relative the the left end of the beam.
      Parameters:
      index -
      Returns:
      Shearing force.

    • setAtIndex

      public void setAtIndex​(int index, ShearingForceValue shearingForceValue)
      Shearing force at a specified index in the table. This method is used by the QSolver- and the MSolver class.
      Parameters:
      index -
      shearingForceValue - The shearing force.

    • addForce

      public void addForce​(Load l)
      Adds a force to this table.
      Parameters:
      l - The Load- object representing the force.

    • getShearingForceTable

      public java.util.List<ShearingForceValue> getShearingForceTable()
      List of shearing forces.
      Returns:
      List of ShearingForceValue- objects.

    • getAbsoluteMaxima

      public ShearingForceValue getAbsoluteMaxima()
      Determines the absolute maximaum value this table contains.
      Returns:
      ShearingForceValue containing the absolute maximum.

    • getAbsoluteMinimum

      public ShearingForceValue getAbsoluteMinimum()
      Determines the absolute lowest value this table contains.
      Returns:
      ShearingForceValue containing the absolute minimum.
